text:
In a macrodef I have 2 attributes a and b. I want to combine their values with
an @ inbetween. Therefore I tried "@{a}@@@{b}", but that prints "(value of
a)@@@{b}". Then I tried "@{a}@@{b}", but that prints "(value of a)@{b}" as
expected. So it is not possible to use an @ before an attribute value.
creator: daniel.spilker@hamburg.de
antoine@apache.org
text:
Maybe you can define a property <property name="atchar" value="@"/>
and use ${atchar}

creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
Neat work-around for 1.6.1 Antoine,
I am testing a fix, should be committed shortly.
Peter

Ok fixed in CVS, should be in ant 1.6.2
@@ is now treated in the same way as $$ for properties
so "@@" -> "@", "@ " -> "@ ", @{a}@@@{b} -> avalue@bvalue
